North West Council
ELECTION.

PRINCE ALBERT. N.W.T.
Feu. 27th.

D. H. Macdowall, Esq.,
of the District of Louis, North West Territory,
having read from his conveyance an extensive
letter from your representative Jno. B.
Gifford, alluding to your intentions in the representation
of your interests among your fellow-men.

pp. xi-xiv.

T. E. Gutton.

PRINCE ALBERT.

REMARKS

And Nathan Rodger,
Chairman of the West End School Board.

Essex Co. Const., P. McCauley, June
1895.

REPLY
Prince Albert, Feb 27th, 1883.
Gentlemen,
I beg to acknowledge receipt of your letter of this date, requesting me to agree myself to be brought forward as a candidate for the North West Territorial Council at the incoming election.
I have much pleasure in accepting your request, and will endeavor to do my best to further its interests not only in the District of Lewis, but within the whole North West, should I be called to represent you in the coming election.

I am, Gentlemen,

Yours Truly,

D. H. Macdowall.
THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES
WEDNESDAY, MAY 9, 1883

DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR
The annual report of the Department of the Interior has been published. As deals entirely with matters in connection with the North-West Territories certain sections of the report will be found particularly interesting and instructive. The report points to the organization of the Department as a striking indication of the rapid settlement of the Territories and illustrates the importance of the correspondence for the year 1882 and that for 1883. In 1881, the number of letters received was 13,600, and the number sent, 14,820. In 1882, the number received was 30,300, and the number sent, 30,300. This shows an increase of 17,000 letters received and sent in 1882 over those received and sent in 1881.

There were in 1882 only 5,600 entries at customs, while in 1881 there were 10,000 entries, representing an increase of 4,400. In 1882, the number of entries was 10,000, while in 1881 there were 10,000 entries, representing an increase of 4,400.

In conclusion, the report shows that the Department is doing its work efficiently and effectively.
